00058 void ptlrpc_initiate_recovery(struct obd_import *imp)
00059 {
00060         ENTRY;
00061 
00062         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: starting recovery\n", obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00063         ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
00064 
00065         EXIT;
00066 }
00067 
00072 int ptlrpc_replay_next(struct obd_import *imp, int *inflight)
00073 {
00074         int rc = 0;
00075         struct list_head *tmp, *pos;
00076         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00077         __u64 last_transno;
00078         ENTRY;
00079 
00080         *inflight = 0;
00081 
00082         /* It might have committed some after we last spoke, so make sure we
00083          * get rid of them now.
00084          */
00085         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00086         imp->imp_last_transno_checked = 0;
00087         ptlrpc_free_committed(imp);
00088         last_transno = imp->imp_last_replay_transno;
00089         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00090 
00091         CDEBUG(D_HA, "import %p from %s committed "LPU64" last "LPU64"\n",
00092                imp, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00093                imp->imp_peer_committed_transno, last_transno);
00094 
00095         /* Do I need to hold a lock across this iteration?  We shouldn't be
00096          * racing with any additions to the list, because we're in recovery
00097          * and are therefore not processing additional requests to add.  Calls
00098          * to ptlrpc_free_committed might commit requests, but nothing "newer"
00099          * than the one we're replaying (it can't be committed until it's
00100          * replayed, and we're doing that here).  l_f_e_safe protects against
00101          * problems with the current request being committed, in the unlikely
00102          * event of that race.  So, in conclusion, I think that it's safe to
00103          * perform this list-walk without the imp_lock held.
00104          *
00105          * But, the {mdc,osc}_replay_open callbacks both iterate
00106          * request lists, and have comments saying they assume the
00107          * imp_lock is being held by ptlrpc_replay, but it's not. it's
00108          * just a little race...
00109          */
00110 
00111         /* Replay all the committed open requests on committed_list first */
00112         if (!list_empty(&imp->imp_committed_list)) {
00113                 tmp = imp->imp_committed_list.prev;
00114                 req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request,
00115                                      rq_replay_list);
00116 
00117                 /* The last request on committed_list hasn't been replayed */
00118                 if (req->rq_transno > last_transno) {
00119                         /* Since the imp_committed_list is immutable before
00120                          * all of it's requests being replayed, it's safe to
00121                          * use a cursor to accelerate the search */
00122                         if (!imp->imp_resend_replay ||
00123                             imp->imp_replay_cursor == &imp->imp_committed_list)
00124                                 imp->imp_replay_cursor =
00125                                         imp->imp_replay_cursor->next;
00126 
00127                         while (imp->imp_replay_cursor !=
00128                                &imp->imp_committed_list) {
00129                                 req = list_entry(imp->imp_replay_cursor,
00130                                                      struct ptlrpc_request,
00131                                                      rq_replay_list);
00132                                 if (req->rq_transno > last_transno)
00133                                         break;
00134 
00135                                 req = NULL;
00136                                 imp->imp_replay_cursor =
00137                                         imp->imp_replay_cursor->next;
00138                         }
00139                 } else {
00140                         /* All requests on committed_list have been replayed */
00141                         imp->imp_replay_cursor = &imp->imp_committed_list;
00142                         req = NULL;
00143                 }
00144         }
00145 
00146         /* All the requests in committed list have been replayed, let's replay
00147          * the imp_replay_list */
00148         if (req == NULL) {
00149                 list_for_each_safe(tmp, pos, &imp->imp_replay_list) {
00150                         req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request,
00151                                              rq_replay_list);
00152 
00153                         if (req->rq_transno > last_transno)
00154                                 break;
00155                         req = NULL;
00156                 }
00157         }
00158 
00159         /* If need to resend the last sent transno (because a reconnect
00160          * has occurred), then stop on the matching req and send it again.
00161          * If, however, the last sent transno has been committed then we
00162          * continue replay from the next request. */
00163         if (req != NULL && imp->imp_resend_replay)
00164                 lustre_msg_add_flags(req->rq_reqmsg, MSG_RESENT);
00165 
00166         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00167         /* The resend replay request may have been removed from the
00168          * unreplied list. */
00169         if (req != NULL && imp->imp_resend_replay &&
00170             list_empty(&req->rq_unreplied_list))
00171                 ptlrpc_add_unreplied(req);
00172 
00173         imp->imp_resend_replay = 0;
00174         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00175 
00176         if (req != NULL) {
00177                 /* The request should have been added back in unreplied list
00178                  * by ptlrpc_prepare_replay(). */
00179                 LASSERT(!list_empty(&req->rq_unreplied_list));
00180 
00181                 rc = ptlrpc_replay_req(req);
00182                 if (rc) {
00183                         CERROR("recovery replay error %d for req "
00184                                LPU64"\n", rc, req->rq_xid);
00185                         RETURN(rc);
00186                 }
00187                 *inflight = 1;
00188         }
00189         RETURN(rc);
00190 }
00191 
00196 int ptlrpc_resend(struct obd_import *imp)
00197 {
00198         struct ptlrpc_request *req, *next;
00199 
00200         ENTRY;
00201 
00202         /* As long as we're in recovery, nothing should be added to the sending
00203          * list, so we don't need to hold the lock during this iteration and
00204          * resend process.
00205          */
00206         /* Well... what if lctl recover is called twice at the same time?
00207          */
00208         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00209         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER) {
00210                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00211                 RETURN(-1);
00212         }
00213 
00214         list_for_each_entry_safe(req, next, &imp->imp_sending_list, rq_list) {
00215                 LASSERTF((long)req > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE && req != LP_POISON,
00216                          "req %p bad\n", req);
00217                 LASSERTF(req->rq_type != LI_POISON, "req %p freed\n", req);
00218 
00219                 /* If the request is allowed to be sent during replay and it
00220                  * is not timeout yet, then it does not need to be resent. */
00221                 if (!ptlrpc_no_resend(req) &&
00222                     (req->rq_timedout || !req->rq_allow_replay))
00223                         ptlrpc_resend_req(req);
00224         }
00225         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00226 
00227         RETURN(0);
00228 }
00229 
00234 void ptlrpc_wake_delayed(struct obd_import *imp)
00235 {
00236         struct list_head *tmp, *pos;
00237         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00238 
00239         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00240         list_for_each_safe(tmp, pos, &imp->imp_delayed_list) {
00241                 req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
00242 
00243                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "waking (set %p):", req->rq_set);
00244                 ptlrpc_client_wake_req(req);
00245         }
00246         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00247 }
00248 
00249 void ptlrpc_request_handle_notconn(struct ptlrpc_request *failed_req)
00250 {
00251         struct obd_import *imp = failed_req->rq_import;
00252         ENTRY;
00253 
00254         CDEBUG(D_HA, "import %s of %s@%s abruptly disconnected: reconnecting\n",
00255                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00256                imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
00257 
00258         if (ptlrpc_set_import_discon(imp,
00259                               lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(failed_req->rq_reqmsg))) {
00260                 if (!imp->imp_replayable) {
00261                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "import %s@%s for %s not replayable, "
00262                                "auto-deactivating\n",
00263                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00264                                imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid,
00265                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
00266                         ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
00267                 }
00268                 /* to control recovery via lctl {disable|enable}_recovery */
00269                 if (imp->imp_deactive == 0)
00270                         ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
00271         }
00272 
00273         /* Wait for recovery to complete and resend. If evicted, then
00274            this request will be errored out later.*/
00275         spin_lock(&failed_req->rq_lock);
00276         if (!failed_req->rq_no_resend)
00277                 failed_req->rq_resend = 1;
00278         spin_unlock(&failed_req->rq_lock);
00279 
00280         EXIT;
00281 }
00282 
00290 int ptlrpc_set_import_active(struct obd_import *imp, int active)
00291 {
00292         struct obd_device *obd = imp->imp_obd;
00293         int rc = 0;
00294 
00295         ENTRY;
00296         LASSERT(obd);
00297 
00298         /* When deactivating, mark import invalid, and abort in-flight
00299          * requests. */
00300         if (!active) {
00301                 LCONSOLE_WARN("setting import %s INACTIVE by administrator "
00302                               "request\n", obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00303 
00304                 /* set before invalidate to avoid messages about imp_inval
00305                  * set without imp_deactive in ptlrpc_import_delay_req */
00306                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00307                 imp->imp_deactive = 1;
00308                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00309 
00310                 obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_DEACTIVATE);
00311 
00312                 ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00313         }
00314 
00315         /* When activating, mark import valid, and attempt recovery */
00316         if (active) {
00317                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "setting import %s VALID\n",
00318                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00319 
00320                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00321                 imp->imp_deactive = 0;
00322                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00323                 obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_ACTIVATE);
00324 
00325                 rc = ptlrpc_recover_import(imp, NULL, 0);
00326         }
00327 
00328         RETURN(rc);
00329 }
00330 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_set_import_active);
00331 
00332 /* Attempt to reconnect an import */
00333 int ptlrpc_recover_import(struct obd_import *imp, char *new_uuid, int async)
00334 {
00335         int rc = 0;
00336         ENTRY;
00337 
00338         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00339         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_NEW || imp->imp_deactive ||
00340             atomic_read(&imp->imp_inval_count))
00341                 rc = -EINVAL;
00342         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00343         if (rc)
00344                 GOTO(out, rc);
00345 
00346         /* force import to be disconnected. */
00347         ptlrpc_set_import_discon(imp, 0);
00348 
00349         if (new_uuid) {
00350                 struct obd_uuid uuid;
00351 
00352                 /* intruct import to use new uuid */
00353                 obd_str2uuid(&uuid, new_uuid);
00354                 rc = import_set_conn_priority(imp, &uuid);
00355                 if (rc)
00356                         GOTO(out, rc);
00357         }
00358 
00359         /* Check if reconnect is already in progress */
00360         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00361         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON) {
00362                 imp->imp_force_verify = 1;
00363                 rc = -EALREADY;
00364         }
00365         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00366         if (rc)
00367                 GOTO(out, rc);
00368 
00369         rc = ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
00370         if (rc)
00371                 GOTO(out, rc);
00372 
00373         if (!async) {
00374                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
00375                 int secs = cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout);
00376 
00377                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery started, waiting %u seconds\n",
00378                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), secs);
00379 
00380                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(secs, NULL, NULL);
00381                 rc = l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
00382                                   !ptlrpc_import_in_recovery(imp), &lwi);
00383                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery finished\n",
00384                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00385         }
00386         EXIT;
00387 
00388 out:
00389         return rc;
00390 }
00391 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_recover_import);
00392 
00393 int ptlrpc_import_in_recovery(struct obd_import *imp)
00394 {
00395         int in_recovery = 1;
00396 
00397         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00398         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL ||
00399             imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED ||
00400             imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON ||
00401             imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov)
00402                 in_recovery = 0;
00403         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00404 
00405         return in_recovery;
00406 }
